definition.name: NXapm_reconstruction

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n
symbol.doc: Number of ions spatially filtered from results of the hit_finding algorithm from which an instance of a reconstructed volume has been generated. These ions get new identifier assigned in the process - the so-called evaporation_identifier, which must not be confused with the pulse_identifier!

definition.doc:
Base class for the configuration and results of a (static) reconstruction algorithm.
Generating a tomographic reconstruction of the specimen uses selected and calibrated ion hit positions, the evaporation sequence, and voltage curve data. Very often scientists use own software scripts according to published procedures, so-called reconstruction protocols.

field.name: parameter
field.doc: Different reconstruction protocols exist. Although these approaches are qualitatively similar, each protocol uses different parameters (and interprets these differently). The source code to IVAS/APSuite is not open. For now users should store reconstruction parameter in this free-text field to guide how to parameterize this better in the future. For LEAP systems and reconstructions performed with IVAS/APSuite see `T. Blum et al. <https://doi.org/10.1002/9781119227250.ch18>`_ (page 371).

group.name: obb
group.doc: Tight, axis-aligned bounding box about the point cloud of the reconstruction.

field.name: protocol_name
field.doc: Qualitative statement about which reconstruction protocol was used.

field.name: crystallographic_calibration
field.doc:
Different strategies for crystallographic calibration of the reconstruction are possible. Therefore, we collect first such feedback before parameterizing this further.
If no crystallographic calibration was performed, the field should be filled with the n/a, meaning not applied.

field.name: field_of_view
field.doc: The nominal diameter of the specimen ROI which is measured in the experiment. The physical specimen cannot be measured completely because ions may launch but hit in locations other than the detector.

field.name: reconstructed_positions
field.doc: Three-dimensional reconstructed positions of the ions.

attribute.name: depends_on
attribute.doc: The instance of :ref:`NXcoordinate_system` in which the positions are defined.

group.doc: To get a first visual overview of the reconstructed dataset, here a 3d histogram of the ion is stored. Ion counts are characterized using one nanometer cubic bins without applying position smoothening algorithms during the histogram computation.
